result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane M Wondrachek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In lieu of payment, defendant to serve 5 days concurrent to any other sentence/sanction the defendant is currently serving.  Court waives DNA sample and surcharge.

Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 67 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: anyother sentence/sanction defendant is currently serving.

records.addlTxt:
Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Shane M Wondrachek in court, in custody, with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.   
Defendant is currently serving a 90 Day DOC Sanction (in lieu of an ATR or Revocation).

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.

Court orders the following:  
120 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
67 Days Credit.
Concurrent to anyother sentence/sanction the defendant is currently serving.

Costs:  $243 - Forthwith - In Lieu of Payment 5 Days Concurrent to any other sentence/sanction the defendant is currently serving.
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
